Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Odometer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The odometer class keeps track of the robot's (x, y, theta) position.
    Author:
    Rodrigo Silva, Dirk Dubois, Derek Yu, Karim El-Baba, Michael Smith, Younes Boubekeur

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean active
      A boolean to indicate if the odometer is active.
      private java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition doneResetting
      Lets other threads know that a reset operation is over.
      private boolean isResetting
      Indicates if a thread is trying to reset any position parameters.
      private static int leftMotorTachoCount  
      private static java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock lock
      Fair lock for concurrent writing.
      private static Odometer odo  
      private double[] position
      The (x, y, theta) position as an array.
      private static int prevLeftMotorTachoCount  
      private static int prevRightMotorTachoCount  
      private static int rightMotorTachoCount  
      private double theta
      The orientation in degrees.
      private double x
      The x-axis position in cm.
      private double y
      The y-axis position in cm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Odometer

        private Odometer()
        This is the default constructor of this class. It initiates all motors and variables once. It cannot be accessed externally.

    • Method Detail

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer()
        Returns the Odometer Object. Use this method to obtain an instance of Odometer.
        Returns:
        the Odometer Object

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is where the logic for the odometer will run.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getXyt

        public double[] getXyt()
        Returns the Odometer data.

        Writes the current position and orientation of the robot onto the odoData array. odoData[0] = x, odoData[1] = y; odoData[2] = theta;

        Returns:
        the odometer data.

      • update

        public void update​(double dx,
                   double dy,
                   double dtheta)
        Adds dx, dy and dtheta to the current values of x, y and theta, respectively. Useful for odometry.
        Parameters:
        dx - the change in x
        dy - the change in y
        dtheta - the change in theta

      • setXyt

        public void setXyt​(double x,
                   double y,
                   double theta)
        Overrides the values of x, y and theta. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x
        y - the value of y
        theta - the value of theta in degrees

      • setX

        public void setX​(double x)
        Overwrites x. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x

      • setY

        public void setY​(double y)
        Overwrites y. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        y - the value of y

      • setTheta

        public void setTheta​(double theta)
        Overwrites theta. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        theta - the value of theta
